datatype.name: IntegHow
datatype.desc: Specifies how an integration was performed. Integrations always come in pairs: the 'forward' and 'reverse' records. As a general rule, the forward records contain the word 'from'; and the reverse records contain the word 'into'.

values.desc: merge from: integration with other changes
branch from: integration was branch of file
copy from: integration took source file whole
dirty merge into: reverse of integration downgraded to edit
dirty branch into: reverse of branch downgraded to add
dirty merge from; merge that the user edited

datatype.note: All integration records should have a corresponding reverse record. The 'branch from' (2) and 'merge from' (0) records have corresponding "dirty" reverse records for cases where the target file took more than one change or was (re)opened for 'edit' or 'add'.
